Description: Volute sherd of Attic pottery volute-krater; underside roughly glazed; exterior: top glazed black; on sides, double row of ivy with black lines to either side and between; trace of added red (miltos) in canalis of volute; pre-firing hole incompletely cut from the inside presumably during manufacture; three unusually large post-firing repair holes, one at lower break.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see British Museum 1888,0601.601.a, probably note from the same krater. The decorative format of volutes changes little between 520 and 400 BC.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 39)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0183) (Phase 1)
